column4: question, whats the syntaxt to install a .rpm or a .tar.gz file
.rpm files aren't really suited for ubuntu - ubuntu uses .deb files.  you can use a program called 'alien' to install them, but it's better to find a .deb, or compile from source.
the .tar.gz is probably the source code; use "tar xf <file.tar.gz>" to extract it, then read the readme
if you manage to find a .deb, do "sudo dpkg -i file.deb" to install it
